result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard F. Stachura was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Participate in the creation of case plan and programming related to associated goals and identified criminogenic needs.  May not have contact with Kevin Penfold or any minors, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Undergo sex offender treatment assessment, mental health treatment and evaluation.  Register as a sex offender.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Michael Barth.  Clerk K. Zirbel.
Count 1 - Total length of sentence:  9 years WSP.
Initial term of confinement:  5 years in WSP, credit for 260 days served.
Length of extended supervision:  4 years w/conditions.
Def. is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Count 2 - Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 10 years consecutive to Count 1.
Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.
Letter rcv'd from P&P Agent along w/additional information regarding Deft's criminal history/adjustments to PSI.  kmk

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Michael Barth.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. disputes the conviction in Illinois listed in the PSI (9/15/1989 offense date).  Atty Barth is to verify with the state of Illinois what the actual record is there.  Sentencing hearing adj. to 1/14/16 at 11:00.  Bond continued.
Blank Not Guilty Verdict Forms - Count One & Two

DAY 2 Continued - Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant Richard F. Stachura in court, in custody and appears with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Clerk: PT 
Jury instructions are given to the jurors and closing arguments are made.  Alternate Juror - Leopoldo V. excused at 9:38.  Final instructions given to the jury and deliberation begins at 9:41.  Verdict reached at 1:50 PM.  Jury finds defendant Guilty in Counts 1 and 2.  Jury Polled and released at 1:57.  State moves for judgment on the verdict and DE is adjudged Guilty.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 12/16/15 at 11:00 AM.

1 thru 14
Exhibits S 1-S14 inventoried and stored in Br 1 Exhibit Room on 11/9/15. vm

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
Court rules on motions in limine.  Jurors are summoned and first oath is given to the jury panel.  Voir dire commences at 9:36 AM and completed at 10:42 AM.  Unselected jurors are excused to the jury room.  Selected jurors are sworn in.  Preliminary instructions are given to the jury and opening statements made.  Sworn in and testified are State's witness: K.J.P.  Court breaks for lunch and jurors are instructed to return at 1:15 PM.  Testimony of K.J.P. resumes.  Sworn in and testitifed are State's witnesses: Haley C. and KPD Detective Jerald Kaiser.  Exhibits 1 thru 14 received and published to the jury. DE was advised of his rights and elected to not testify.  Both parties rest at 4:04 PM.  No rebuttal, evidence is closed.  Court breaks for the day and instructs jurors to return at 8:30 AM.  Atty Barth moves to dismiss; motion is denied.
State's List of Exhibits filed by ADA Drees

NO RECORD TAKEN:   Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney Michael Robert Barth appeared.  Clerk: PT
Case remains on for trial on Monday.
State's list of exhibits - filed by ADA M Drees.
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Drees

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved at this time.  Jury Status on 10/29/15 at 1:00 PM;  Jury Trial on 11/2/15 at 8:30 AM.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard F. Stachura
Current: c/o KENOSHA COUNTY JAIL,   (Effective: 07-08-2015)
Prior: 11507 277th Avenue, Trevor, WI 53179
Final pre-trial on July 23, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Due to a continued jury trial; FPT rescheduled to 7/23/15 at 11:15 AM pending confirmation from Atty Barth.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Michael Barth. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-30-15 @ 8:50am. Atty. Barth moves to modify bond. State waives notice requirement but opposes bond modification. Bond continued.

1:31  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matt Perz. Clerk LE.   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  5-7-15 @ 10:00 am.   $5000.00 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*No Contact w/ K.J.P (DOB 8/6/99) or residence or anyone under the age of 18
948.07(1) - Child Enticement  - 948.02(2) - Sexual Assault of a child under 16 yrs of age
